page.title: 16GOVERNMENT /LAW AND ORDER
page.content: There is one 'police house' in Colinsburgh with one "local bobby", although he works from the larger police station base of Anstruther and so has to deal with wider problems. Similarly 'outside ' police may have to deal with any Colinsburgh fracas, which are few. In North East Fife District of Fife region, much of the local government is done by the District.Wider issues,(education,police etc) are the oversee of the Region. The currently elected M.P. is Conservative. The villagers can air direct grievances to the monthly Colinsburgh and Kilconquhar Community Council and occasionally this body can bring successful pressure to bear.
